channel.title: Raisa Pogorelova — Letters from Germany, 1942–1944
channel.description: Recent content on Raisa Pogorelova — Letters from Germany, 1942–1944

item.title: May 8, 1942 — First Diary Entry
item.description: “The first diary of my life.” Raisa describes leaving Kyiv on April 14, the frozen blood, and arrival in Kraków.

item.title: May 1942 — Twenty-One Nights in a Horse Stable
item.description: Ansbach transit camp. Promised one night in a city stable. Stayed twenty-one.

item.title: May 1942 — Separation
item.description: Raisa and her companion Raya are assigned to different farms. The moment they realize they won’t be together.

item.title: May 9–10, 1942 — First Days on the Farm
item.description: Meeting Kurban. The cowshed at 4:55 AM. The second night — cried until morning.
